main event: A bright, saucer-shaped object was observed over Suva, Fiji Islands on April 21, 1963, and a fireball-like object was seen falling into the sea near Laucala Bay on April 3, 1963.
interesting points: The saucer-shaped object was silver in color, estimated to be around 75 feet in diameter, and was observed for about 2 minutes before disappearing rapidly towards the west.
The fireball-like object was described as being 'thunderlike' and 'whitish', creating a bright light as it fell into the sea near Laucala Bay.
Multiple witnesses, including a prominent business man, Fijian policemen, and a housewife, reported seeing the strange objects.

The object observed by the U.S. Air Force KC-135 jet tanker was approximately the same size as the aircraft, circular in shape, and metallic in appearance. It maintained a constant position next to the aircraft for about 25 minutes before accelerating and disappearing.
The object observed by the KC-135 crew did not show up on the aircraft's radar, and no other aircraft were in the vicinity at the time.
sighted object: Saucer-shaped object, fireball-like object, unidentified object observed by U.S. Air Force crew
witnesses: Prominent business man, Fijian policemen, housewife, U.S. Air Force crew
